meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Alright, let's get down to business! I'm reviewing the latest installment in the iconic Street Fighter series – Street Fighter 6. Now, I know what you're thinking: what sets this game apart from its predecessors? Well, buckle up, folks, because I'm about to spill all the tea.

First off, I gotta give it up to these other critics for being so... enthusiastic. GameSpot's critic is basically in a relationship with Street Fighter 6 – poor guy! Slant Magazine's review reads like a love letter, while Gaming Age's writer might be slightly biased towards the game ( Drive Impacts, anyone?). Vandal and SpazioGames are both raving about the gameplay, and GamingTrend thinks it's the next big thing in fighting games. And Destructoid? They're basically singing Street Fighter 6's praises from the rooftops!

Now that I've given those critics some well-deserved love, let me get to the nitty-gritty. As someone who's not a hardcore Street Fighter fan (yet), I was blown away by SF6's battle system. It's like they took all the best parts of previous games and blended them with some fresh new flavors. And don't even get me started on the modes – World Tour is basically a never-ending fun fest!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But wait, [Critic Name], didn't you mention some small issues with performance?" Ah, yes! Well, let's just say that those minor hiccups are more like pesky little ants compared to the elephant-sized fun that is Street Fighter 6. It's a minor quibble in an otherwise fantastic package.

In conclusion, I'm thrilled to report that Street Fighter 6 is a masterpiece – and if you're anything like me, you'll be hooked from the get-go! So grab some friends (or not – online multiplayer, anyone?), get ready to rumble, and experience the ultimate fighting game for yourself. Hippo Penny approves, folks!
